Does this needs to be public ?
It exposes ObjectNode to public surface
all of the new public constructors are in the implementation package not in the public surface area.
all of the new public constructors are in the implementation package not in the public surface area.
Same, and everywhere else. azure-core will not allow exposing ObjectNode
all of the new public constructors are in the implementation package not in the public surface area.

When we down cast JsonNode to ObjectNode we should make sure it is never an ArrayNode. Why don't we just use it as JsonNode itself and why do we need to convert it to ObjectNode any reason? I understand that we were previously converting it to a ObjectNode eventually node->json->objectnode. So this might not be an issue but just a thought
